lines.speaker: Kortica
lines.text: You're not imagining things. You've been pulled inside your own computer's cyberspace.

lines.speaker: Kortica
lines.text: I checked your activity logs. It looks like you clicked on a suspicious link and downloaded a file without verifying it.

lines.speaker: Kortica
lines.text: Based on internet search archives I've accessed, that's the same behavior that leads to real-world infections-viruses, malware, even trojans spreading from shady downloads. In your case, that reckless click created a gateway... and it dragged you inside.

lines.speaker: Student
lines.text: So... I'm stuck here because I was careless?

lines.speaker: Kortica
lines.text: Exactly. Many people outside get tricked the same way. You just paid the price more directly.

lines.speaker: Student
lines.text: Alright... if this place is infected, what kind of dangers are in here?

lines.speaker: Kortica
lines.text: Good question. Again, let me reference some common cases from the internet:

lines.speaker: Kortica
lines.text: Worms - I found reports of them spreading endlessly through networks. They act fast, multiplying until the system crashes.

lines.speaker: Kortica
lines.text: Malware - Search results show countless cases where it sabotages files, steals, data, or slows everything down.

lines.speaker: Kortica
lines.text: Trojans - They appear safe, but articles describe how they trick people, then secretly unleash other threats.

lines.speaker: Kortica
lines.text: Ransomware - Real cases show how they exploit weaknesses, just like intruders breaking into unlocked houses.

lines.speaker: Student
lines.text: So all of those could be crawling around my PC right now?

lines.speaker: Kortica
lines.text: The same way you would protect your real computer:

lines.speaker: Kortica
lines.text: Use antivirus software to detect and remove threats. Build firewalls to block suspicious traffic. Add multi-factor authentication to keep intruders out. And secure everything with encryption, so even if attackers get in, your data is unreadable.
